title: Part A
stimulusHtml:
1 point is earned if finds f'(x) and g'(x) explicitly

1 point is earned for setting student's f'(x) equal to student's g'(x) explicitly

1 point is earned for setting f(x) = g(x)

1 point is earned for solving for x and k

f ′ ( x )=− e −x ;   g ′ ( x )=k − e −x =k←+2 e −x =kx x=−1 and k=−e
descriptions:
The student response earns none of the following points:

1 point is earned if finds f'(x) and g'(x) explicitly

1 point is earned for setting student's f'(x) equal to student's g'(x) explicitly

1 point is earned for setting f(x) = g(x)

1 point is earned for solving for x and k

f ′ ( x )=− e −x ;   g ′ ( x )=k − e −x =k←+2 e −x =kx x=−1 and k=−e

The student response earns one of the following points:

1 point is earned if finds f'(x) and g'(x) explicitly

1 point is earned for setting student's f'(x) equal to student's g'(x) explicitly

1 point is earned for setting f(x) = g(x)

1 point is earned for solving for x and k

f ′ ( x )=− e −x ;   g ′ ( x )=k − e −x =k←+2 e −x =kx x=−1 and k=−e

The student response earns two of the following points:

1 point is earned if finds f'(x) and g'(x) explicitly

1 point is earned for setting student's f'(x) equal to student's g'(x) explicitly

1 point is earned for setting f(x) = g(x)

1 point is earned for solving for x and k

f ′ ( x )=− e −x ;   g ′ ( x )=k − e −x =k←+2 e −x =kx x=−1 and k=−e

The student response earns three of the following points:

1 point is earned if finds f'(x) and g'(x) explicitly

1 point is earned for setting student's f'(x) equal to student's g'(x) explicitly

1 point is earned for setting f(x) = g(x)

1 point is earned for solving for x and k

f ′ ( x )=− e −x ;   g ′ ( x )=k − e −x =k←+2 e −x =kx x=−1 and k=−e

The student response earns all of the following points:

1 point is earned if finds f'(x) and g'(x) explicitly

1 point is earned for setting student's f'(x) equal to student's g'(x) explicitly

1 point is earned for setting f(x) = g(x)

1 point is earned for solving for x and k

f ′ ( x )=− e −x ;   g ′ ( x )=k − e −x =k←+2 e −x =kx x=−1 and k=−e

title: Part B
stimulusHtml:
2 points are earned for integral

1 point is earned if anti-differentiates

∫ −1 0 ( e −x −( −ex ) )  dx= ∫ −1 0 ( e −x +ex )  dx                                                         = ( − e −x + e x 2 2 ) ] −1 0                                                         =( −1+0 )−( −e+ e 2 )                                                         = e 2 −1

title: Part C
stimulusHtml:
2 points are earned for setting up integral with correct integrand

1 point deducted for incorrect limits/error involving π

π ∫ −1 0 ( ( e −x ) 2 − ( −ex ) 2 ) dx
descriptions:
The student response earns none of the following points:

2 points are earned for setting up integral with correct integrand

1 point deducted for incorrect limits/error involving π

π ∫ −1 0 ( ( e −x ) 2 − ( −ex ) 2 ) dx
